metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14612 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 4.17.10. There is an invalid pointer dereference in btrfs_root_node() when mounting a crafted btrfs image, because of a lack of chunk block group mapping validation in btrfs_read_block_groups in fs/btrfs/extent-tree.c, and a lack of empty-tree checks in check_leaf in fs/btrfs/tree-checker.c. Wen Xu and Po-Ning Tseng discovered that btrfs file system implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly validate metadata. An attacker could use this to construct a malicious btrfs image that, when mounted, could cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14612` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-145-generic - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-lowlatency - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-145-generic - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-145-lowlatency - 4.4.0-145.171
